meanings.definition: The condition of having no leaves.
meanings.sent1: The plant's aphylly was unusual, as most plants have leaves.
meanings.sent2: The aphylly of the tree made it look bare and unique.
meanings.sent3: The aphylly of the cactus made it seem like it was wearing an invisible cloak.
meanings.sent4: In the garden of aphylly, the trees whispered secrets to the wind.
meanings.sent5: The aphylly of winter painted the landscape in shades of gray.

meanings.definition: The absence of leaves on a plant.
meanings.sent1: The aphylly of the shrub puzzled the gardener.
meanings.sent2: The garden displayed an interesting mix of aphylly and lush greenery.
meanings.sent3: The aphylly of the plant was like a magic trick gone wrong.
meanings.sent4: The field of aphylly was a canvas waiting for the artist's touch.
meanings.sent5: The aphylly of the forest in autumn was a sight to behold.
